intro: Clibadium rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves and small, yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Clibadium rotundifolium is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
